isis.stitle: TSI 91-04-03 - Brake Air Pressure Distribution Valve (Automatic Front Wheel Limiting Valve) (Code 04567)

subjectgroup.subject: Brake Air Pressure Distribution Valve (Automatic Front Wheel Limiting Valve) (Code 04567)

geninfo.para: This TSI affects all vehicles with FMVSS-121 Air Brake System.

Automatic front wheel limiting valves alter the brake balance designed into Navistar vehicles by reducing pressure to the front brakes under all but full or near full pressure stops. This adversely affects brake life and vehicle control; consequently, Navistar continues to discourage the use of automatic front wheel limiting valves.

Some customers and drivers feel that the vehicle should not have front wheel brakes at all; others believe they will have better vehicle control if there is reduced front braking through the use of an automatic front wheel limiting valves. Navistar is convinced that full use of the front brakes is in the best interest of vehicle handling and brake performance. The only reason that automatic front wheel limiting valves are available is because of customer demand. Engineering does not recommend them.

International brake systems are designed for balanced braking between steer and drive axles. It is necessary to brake evenly on all wheel positions to assure stopping in the shortest possible distance. Use of the automatic front wheel limiting valve will not provide optimum balanced braking. Customers should be made aware of the potential problems that can result from the use of the automatic front wheel limiting valve. For example:

item.para: Increased Rear Axle Brake Wear - During normal brake stops, the automatic front wheel limiting valve decreases pressure to the front brakes to approximately half the pressure applied to the rear brakes. The results will be more wear and braking by the rear brakes. Existing designs attempt to balance wear between the front and rear axles without the automatic front wheel limiting valve. Use of the automatic front wheel limiting valve will shorten lining life on the drive axles.

Glazing and Noise-A brake needs to be worked to assure proper burnishing and effectiveness. The use of an automatic front wheel limiting valve will reduce front brake work and lower its operating temperature, which can cause glazing of the lining and brake noise.
Vehicle Control- A vehicle needs to have brake torque applied to the axles experiencing vehicle load (static and dynamic) for balanced braking. Front wheel limiting valves alter this balance.

note.para: Navistar does not recommend the use of the automatic front wheel limiting valve.
